mental_model.explanation: React acts as the Architect. You provide the Blueprint (JSX/Components). When data changes, the Architect redraws a new Blueprint (Virtual DOM), compares it to the old one (Diffing), and gives specific instructions to the construction crew (ReactDOM) to change *only* the parts of the building that are different (Reconciliation).

real_world_use_cases: Building Single Page Applications (SPAs) with complex, interactive UIs.
Creating reusable UI components for a design system.
Managing dynamic data updates efficiently without reloading the page.

related_concepts.relationship: Alternative frameworks. React differs by focusing on 'Just JavaScript' and unidirectional data flow.
The old way. Direct DOM manipulation vs React's declarative state-driven approach.

concepts.name: Virtual DOM
concepts.description: A lightweight copy of the actual DOM kept in memory.
details: React creates a new Virtual DOM tree on every render.
It compares (diffs) this new tree with the previous one.
It calculates the minimum number of updates needed for the real DOM.

concepts.name: JSX
concepts.description: A syntax extension for JavaScript that looks like HTML.
details: It allows writing UI structure directly within JavaScript logic.
It prevents Injection Attacks by escaping values by default.

concepts.name: Unidirectional Data Flow
concepts.description: Data flows one way: down from parent to child via props.
details: Makes application state predictable and easier to debug.
To update parent state, children invoke callback functions passed down as props (Inverse Data Flow).

concepts.name: Hooks
concepts.description: Functions that let you 'hook into' React state and lifecycle features from function components.
details: Replaced the need for Class Components.
Enable logic reuse via Custom Hooks.
Rules: Only call at the top level, only call from React functions.
